newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit trades in wide range, seen volatile.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit trades in wide range, seen volatile.

text.p: * Ringgit opens stronger, but seen in wide range
* All regional currencies strengthen on rumours central banks could investigate those holding long dollars
* Ringgit expected to remain volatile in absence of fresh news
The ringgit opened higher, but traded in a wide range as rumours of central bank actions pushed up all regional currencies, dealers said on Wednesday.
Dealers said some Southeast Asian central banks were rumoured to be checking the books of all banks to trace the source of recent currency instability in the region.
The central banks were also urging local banks not to hold long dollar positions, they said.
"The rumours have caused some strengthening of regional currencies," said a dealer with a Malaysian bank.
Another Malaysian dealer said dollar/ringgit would continue to be volatile with its movement exaggerated by low volumes and wide spreads.
At 0145 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.6250/80 a dollar.
